inn1.comm: a cracking ball to begin with! Angling into the batsman before nipping away, massively. Virtually unplayable
ooh and he's squared up here, squirting it into the covers. More outswing, and excellent pace for Anderson
on middle-and-off, swinging away but Ouma jabs down on it - albeit with his feet pointing back down the pitch
fuller this time from Anderson; Ouma, back in his crease, is watchful in defence, shuffling across his stumps to counter the swing
in the channel outside his off stump, but it's a touch too short this time and Ouma rightly leaves it well alone
and he's off the mark with a solid tickle down to fine leg, as Anderson rather loses his line
and a good start, just outside off stump - no great pace, or swing, but a good line which Ouma shoulders arms to
too fast for Ouma, swinging down the leg side and he can't whip it away. Should've...but it cannoned into his pads
again, not really the right line from Mahmood, drifting into Ouma's pads who tucked it to leg
outside off this time and clunked into the covers, although without properly timing it
short of a length and Ouma goes for it, rocking back and trying to pull it through midwicket with a super swivel. But it's walloped straight to midwicket
pushed out calmly into the covers
and a good one to end the over, right up to Ouma who is solid in defence
ooh, very wide from Mr Anderson - maybe we should all call cricketers more formally, ala the 19th Century - and swinging wider of Shah who leaves alone
good line, this, from Anderson, attacking Shah's off stump. A touch too short. Shah goes back and punches it neatly into the covers
ah, brilliant ball. As perfect as a non-wicket-taking delivery can get, drawing Shah into the stroke before it swings away from his on-the-drive-defensive prod
too full, on leg, and worked to mid-on for a single. Shah's off the mark
touch too wide, Ouma leaves well alone
again, too wide - no need to touch those, and it swings wider still of Ouma's arm-shouldering
ugly wide. Short, drifting down the leg side. That's Mahmood at his most unconvincing
short again, but on off stump this time and a neat cut down to third man brings him an easy single
and this time, a no ball as it's defended on the front foot
slightly fuller, defended back to the bowler
ooh big shout. Well, half-big - and only from Mahmood. Not a big shout at all, then - as the batsman is rapped on the pads, but it's going down leg
lovely, elegant square cut past the infield. Delicious shot - typical of Shah, just getting on top of the bounce and guiding it, not trying to smash it
and he goes for a repeat of the previous stroke, but it's too full to be cutting and it bobbles rather pathetically into the gully
short of a length, again Shah goes back and pings it to point. Great timing, less-great placement
no no no. Too wide from Anderson, swinging wider still and it's left alone
ooh and he nearly fishes at this before deciding, rightly so, to leave alone
more massive banana swing, booming away from the batsman like a big boomer. Too wide
and the inswinger into his pads, pushed to leg with ease
gone! Well, Shah should've come forward there. Back in his crease, the ball kept low and he just couldn't get his bat down in time
very well bowled, another inswinger. Suji steps to leg, nervously, and defends with a very wishy wafty bat
wrong line, on leg stump and they steal a leg-bye-bye
again he drifts this down the leg side, again they pick up a single
better line this time, swinging into the batsman's pads on off stump and, belatedly, Flintoff half-roars an appeal
that's more like the Flintoff of old, outside off and it passes by his outside edge
ooh and it's full, fast, straight and squirted out into the covers
full, fast, outside the off stump and it's very neatly guided past gully down to third man
firmly defended on the front foot, coming right forward - head over the ball, and a resounding ping of the bat is heard as he clamps down on it
and it's left alone outside off
oh and another cracking ball swinging away from a very suspect forward defence. Inches away from edging it
and this is Anderson's problem. His stray balls. Down the leg side and flicked fine of Nixon who can't get a hand to it
good length, good line, but brick-walled into the covers
fine shot as Anderson drifts it on his pads, looking for swing, and he whips it just in front of square for four
ooh, tentatively comes forward to squirt this past point. Reasonably solidly played, in the end, but good swing from him again
back onto his stumps - not literally, obviously - and it's punched off the back foot
yikes! That's cut back quite markedly on the batsman who shoulders arms
punched off the back foot - more bounce from Flintoff, who is firing in here but hasn't quite found his line
short of a length and it's neatly pumped off the back foot to mid-on
ooh and a swing and a miss! On off stump, swinging away from his rather fishing attempt at an off drive
driven, with a closed face of the bat - Flintoff gets a hand to it, collapsing his hugs frame down on the pitch and lumbering out his left hand
and he comes forward solidly to defend this last ball of the over
off the back foot and smacked into the covers
short of a length, whipped past midwicket
again a touch too short but he can't bisect the gap at cover
an ugly, cross-batted smite which gets him a thick inside edge that fortunately evades his off stump
again no foot movement; again a cross-batted mow which gets him nothing
but they pick up a leg bye here as Anderson loses his line
just short of a length and it rises onto the batsman who, to his credit, defends it very neatly off the back foot with a pleasing clunk of the bat
neat stroke off the back foot, almost on-driving it through midwicket
pushed past point and third man jogs across to collect it
again, he's right back onto his stumps, defending it with a high front elbow but can't bisect the gap
pushed off the back foot to Mmmmonty Panesar at mid-on
edged just past Joyce at a lone, wide first slip who dived to his right, but it fell just short and wide of him
swinging into the batsman, who pushes at it off the back foot to Collingwood at mid-on. A shimmy to his right, and he takes the simplest of catches
ooh, very well bowled! Late inswing, at impressive pace, and Tikolo defends off the back foot
cut, hard, but straight to point. A loose delivery from Anderson which deserved four, but Tikolo finds point
ah, there we go, that's what Tikolo was attempting the previous ball. He crashes this in front of square for four
edged! Well, was that intentional? Perhaps. I'll give it to the batsman. A firm slash which races between keeper and slip
pushed to mid-off
outside off and that's left alone as it flies harmlessly through
just outside off and that's driven through cover
tickled to midwicket
down that channel again and it can only be left alone
ah, overstepped, Flintoff just missing his footing there, but managed, at least, to stay afloat. (C'mon, you love it)
poked down to the gully
stands tall and drives off the back foot
oops, not a very impressive start, very wide, the loosest of looseners
driven to mid-on without much power
oh hello! But Peter Parker says that height was a factor - could only be, really - as that was ramrod straight
overstepped and that's driven through mid-off, lovely timing from Stevie there, just caressing his hands through the line
Tikoloed in front of square and that's another run for Kenya
oh, cut right over that one, nearly taking the under edge
cut down off the back foot to point
cut down again to point
strays on leg, but it's a good length and that's just played off the pads into the short midwicket region
shorter and played easily with a well-timed pull down in front of square
defended on the back foot
short and that's flashed hard past the vacant third slip
closer to the body, but short of a good length, still that's just prodded down off the back foot
slower ball, beauty, and that undoes Suji, who has the good grace to smile
bends over that one to defend
on middle-and-leg and that's defended forward
wide, swinging gently away towards off, and that's just helped off the back foot
outside off and driven square, straight to the fielder, and it's well picked up
on the button and defended forward
dragged down and that's played easily to square - the throw coming in to the bowler's end
inside edge nearly dragged onto the stumps
huge, straight bouncer and for some reason that wasn't called wide
good slower ball, right up there and that's defended forward
slower ball and that's driven over the top of cover
worked down off the back foot to midwicket
played in front of square
played back to the bowler
horrible inside edge goes behind square
defended forward
big appeal from Nixon there for a snick - there was definitely a noise, but must have been the ball flicking the outside of the pad
slower ball tucked off the hips to deep square
driven on the front foot to cover and that's picked up
guided down to third man for a single and a steal of the old strike
slower ball to start the over, cheeky, nice, and that's defended forward tidily enough
aerial drive for four, clean strike
dinked down off the hips, square
well, sad to say that was a bit inevitable - Suji not really hitting through the cover-drive on his front foot and popping that one, softly, to the man in at cover
left alone outside off
bangs down an attempted bouncer, it doesn't really lift - chest height, max - and that's defended down off the back foot easily enough
straight, a good shout, but Nixon pulls out of an appeal, as that one took some edge
on middle and that's driven back to the bowler, Collingwood, who practises his best ten-pin bowling strike action with a mock shy at the stumps
short, doesn't get up, and the batsman has time to caress that behind point. Nice caressing
played out to the cover boundary where that's swept by the man who knows what his job is (ie the sweeper)
a loose shot, on one knee and chops that one right into his stumps and there are some big celebrations there for Collingwood, the two-handed hop
played over that one on the back foot
short and whipped wristily in front of midwicket where Monty fields and this all looks much better now I've taken capslock off and retyped it
oh, nearly another for England there, as the batsman just lets his bat droop away from his body and that bounces down in front of the keeper
poked into the covers
full and that's driven in front of midwicket
on leg and that's played down off the hips in front of square
right up there and the batsman walks into that one and ends up defending
short and that's dinked off the back foot to the gully
(tomato) souped through mid-off with a crashing drive. Collingwood hurt his fingertip trying to stop that one
short and dibbled towards the cover boundary for a quick single
edge, but that fell safe
driven out to long-off where it's thrown back in quickly
on the money, slower ball to end the over and that's a nice big defence
defended down off the back foot, straight and true
driven into cover
outside off, wide, and a firm outside edge races through third man
pulled square
again short and he paddles it around the corner to Monty at fine leg who receives cheers, for no reason in particular
clunked to cover. Not a properly timed clunk, either, and it meekly bobbles out
swinging into the batsman who defends on the front foot
nicely bowled! Cutting back into the batsman who gets a thick inside edge
and he stands tall, takes a heavy step down the ground and smites it with gross power past Collingwood for four
super slower ball there, but it's read by the batsman who closes the book and switches off the light
"yes Colly," shouts the shy Nixon behind the stumps as this outswinger is firmly defended
slow and spearing down the leg side like a piece of driftwood. Nasty delivery, rightly called a wide
have some of that. Again drifting into his pads, a clean, well-timed pick-up over midwicket gives him four. Well placed and extremely well timed too
nice start. Quick and flat, punched out into the covers
tossed up high - Nixon is getting vocal now - and it's driven into the covers

rapped on the pads, the ball bobbles out past slip and Obuya calls Tikolo through. But he won't run! Obuya's stranded - in comes the throw...and Monty whips off the bails. Dreadful cricket, and Obuya is furious
pushed calmly into the covers
oh fine shot, crashing this one backward of square. Too short from Monty
and it's defended on the front foot to end the over
quickish but too straight and it's nudged off his legs
wider of the crease, just a touch; full, spearing into him and it's very neatly driven indeed, timing it well past the infield and out to the extra cover boundary
brick-walled back to the bowler - but a good line, this, from Flintoff, just on his off stump
swinging into the batsman who misreads it, trying to flick it over midwicket, he loses his balance and is rapped on the pads
short and pulled around the corner to Anderson at deep square leg who pings in a decent throw
down the leg side. No, no, no. Wide
and he's right behind this one, blocking it out like a bouncer rejecting a teenage alcopop-drinker on a Friday night
on off stump, he comes forward and drives it cleanly into the covers
punched, without power, to mid-off
too short from Monty, and too flat - the batsman just uses the pace of the ball to whip it through midwicket
ooh nearly! Mistimed back to Monty who dived to his right and very nearly took a blinder
timed into the covers
good end to the over as this flat, quick ball can only be punched straight to cover
well, once again Flintoff wobbles this down the leg side and it's easily worked to leg
spearing into the batsman - half a shout from Flintoff. "How's?" was all he could shout, though Nixon did manage to complete the appeal with a more erudite "Owsa?" as he is rapped on the pads
calmly, if meekly, prodded past midwicket and they jog a single
ah, neat stroke, really well timed but straight to long-off

half-an-appeal, and it's out! What a bizarre shout for lbw. Angling into the batsman - big inswing, which probably caused the doubt in Flintoff's appeal who, like us, perhaps thought it was drifting down leg. But mid-appeal, he ramped it up to 11 and roared the question with fervour. And up went the finger
ooh much better appeal here, and it looks out - but Pete Parker turns it down! Good grief, cricket's an odd game. That was plumb
padded away. With his pad.
crisply driven past the infield and there's his fifty
defended on the front foot
blocked out, bat behind the pad
crisply spanked into the covers. But straight to the covers
spanked off the back foot behind point
pinged to the Irishman at mid-on, Joyce, who dives to his right but spills it.
driven back to the bowler
no shot, shouldering arms to a straight one! Never a good plan, frankly
close! On the front foot and he just gets his bat down in time
and outside off, passes the outside edge
defended on the front foot
played out to cover
touch too full and it's crashed to cover. But straight to cover
down the pitch, smacking it hard and fast but Monty fields well
pinged down to long-off
on off stump, turning away a touch but it's well smothered by the batsman. Using his bat.
crashed off the back foot behind square
swinging into the batsman who defends it back to the bowler
more inswing, and it's firmly defended
ah, neat stroke, just driving that calmly out past the covers
driven to mid-on
on leg stump, whipped to midwicket
play and a miss! Very close
pushed back to the bowler
just short of a length, crashed behind square - too wide and it gets what it deserves. A big four.
driven out to deep cover
the wrong line from Monty, on leg stump and it's easily swept
on middle-and-leg - much better Montyness and it's firmly defended
played down to gully and that's straight to the fielder
straight, a touch of room allows the righthander to work that to leg, but falls over a bit in that shot

outside off and that's played off the back foot  into the covers - a mix-up and that really should have been run out, but Bell's throw to Anderson was a bit too hesitant, and his own work was hesitant as well
overthrow potential there and Vaughan's hands are on his head as he misses that one
drifts into the leg and he tries to rush that one to square, but doesn't time it properly
Anderson wings that one down leg, his head right down as usual as he released it, and the batsman gamely chases, but is too late on the shot
plays that one down off the back foot behind point
on the sixpence and the batsman can only defend
on middle and the batsman pads up to that one, with a big stride forward. "How is he?!" cries Nixon. He is not out
a good shot from Kamande, sweeping that one fine. "Kamanding shot" arf-arfs Gnasho in the corner
on leg and that's swept round again, but not as fine, and there's room for the two
a play and a miss
a hop, skip but no jump, from the batsman, creeping forward and nearly unintentionally doing the splits in driving that one to cover
outside off and mistimed by Tikolo, looking to cut that one down through cover; just plays over in the end
slower ball and that's driven to mid-on. "Brilliant, Paul," exaggerates Nixon
driven to the covers this time
short, a scoop outside off, misses and Nixon quickly whips the bails off just because he can and not because the stumping was genuinely on
drags that short and towards leg - Kamande doesn't miss out, picking that off at knee height and playing it through fine leg
outside off and a mis-timed single skews to mid-on
timed off the back foot inside the cover boundary - they look for two, but find only one
finely swept behind square for an easy two
played out to point this time
driven into the ground - again, the timing is not quite there - and that rolls slowly towards cover
"Catch it" jokes Nixon as that one flies up but nowhere near the fielder, Anderson sweeping up on the off-side boundary
good delivery, Kamande playing and missing at one which curves deliciously away from him
clipped firmly away in front of square for two to bring up the 150
left alone outside off
overpitched and a half-volley is driven out to long-off
steps back to give himself room to the slower ball, but the offcutter hits off stump with the batsman swinging across the line
swinging into the righthander, low, and the batsman does well to dig that one out just short of yorker length in front of off
frees his arms to drive that slower ball back past Collingwood - stops on the shot and that rolls tamely back to the bowler
played off the front foot in front of square
dabbed down with a jink of a forward defensive
on leg and Panesar does a vaguely comical slow, filmic dive back over the ball to stop it
driven to cover and there's a quick single
goes for the big hoick into hoicksville but it's too wide outside his off stick to get anything on it
whacked in front of midwicket where it's collected by Pietersen. Pretty hitting this isn't
defended right over the ball this time
played into the covers and that's a quick single
pushed right up there and that's driven back to the man at long-off
driven to cover
cheeky shot from Tikolo, just presenting the face of the bat outside off to turn it to midwicket
golf swing and that's sliced into the sand trap at cover
customary wide
brings that one down short, and it curves away from off, poked into the cover
whisked that off the front foot to midwicket
slower ball, well disguised, and that fools the batsman at first; he goes to prod, then pulls out of the shot
tucks the batsman up on leg this time
another slower ball and that cuts in off the seam at the righthander, it rises a touch, and that's poked down out to third man
on off and there's a fielding error that would give schoolboys a bad name, by Vaughan, just about getting a hand to it at cover, and that enables a second
driven to long-off
brilliant reverse-swinging yorker does him. As he went back past him, the bowler patted him on the back and said well batted. And indeed it was
low full toss and that's nearly bowled him or trapped him LBW or similar, and that was poked down on at the last minute
right up there and defended
yorker, well dug out
ooh, that one just evades a diving Nixon who gets a hand to it
short, on leg, and help yourself. He does, but Collingwood does some audacious fielding with his foot to keep that well in
dabbed down to gully, gets halfway down the track and realises he's got to get back  - there's an underarm throw from Vaughan, very very tidy indeed, and that's gone
strides forward to drive that one off the toes into short midwicket
short outside off and that's worked to point
slower ball again from Mahmood, picked, and worked out with a cut from outside off
very quick single, well worked and Varaiya will face the first ball of the final over
good yorker and Flintoff tries to replicate Collingwood's tricksy footwork with a kick towards the sticks and that would have been out if he'd only got it inside the posts
low full toss swiped off the back foot all the way down to third man who wings it back in without fuss
well bowled and that's defended back to the bowler
short and that's worked into the off side where Pietersen wings it back in, but still allowing the second
a play and a miss - dinking over that one, and jumping into the shot
excellent work from Nixon - the batsman stabbing behind and just to say getting bat on it, setting off for the run. Nixon goes down on one knee and throws down the stumps from a good ten metres

inn2.comm: on leg stump, Joyce comes forward and rather falls away in the process and nudges it to leg
on middle stump this time, Joyce comes forward to defend on the front foot
just short of a length, Joyce goes back and defends on the back foot
cracking ball! Terrible shot, mind...just feeling for it outside off. Very wafty.
tucked off his hip for a single just behind square. Odoyo's lines rather inconsistent so far
very nicely bowled indeed, that's the line to Vaughan. Angling in on middle-and-off, cutting away at the last minute but Vaughan clamps down on it
good start, but a good leave from Joyce. Just short of a length, Joyce leaves well alone and it takes the wicketkeeper by surprise, spitting up at him and he takes it head height
fuller this time, allowing Joyce to defend it with caution on the front foot. "No run" is the call
oh, delicious shot, an elegant check-drive through cover for four. Pure timing
better line just outside off, Joyce watches it pass by
too wide of the off stump; Joyce again leaves alone
solidly forward and pushed out square of the wicket
very full, Vaughan almost caught by surprise there. Back in his crease he digs it out to mid-on
oops, didn't look like Vaughan was really in control of that, slashing a wide delivery aerially past the two slips through a vacant gully, and down to third man
Joyce goes for a fierce cut stroke, but it's about as well timed as one of my jokes
good delivery rising up at the left-hander who is back in his crease, defending it with a straight bat
good grief that's well timed. On leg stump, he just turned his wrists, playing it at the last minute and it fairly zooted behind square for four. Fine leg didn't have a chance
gone! No, but mere millimetres from plucking out his off stump. I'm not sure it didn't clip it, actually - swinging in late to Joyce, so much so that the wicketkeeper was beaten too
Gone! No easy pickings for Vaughan today. The ball spat up at him and all Vaughan could do was fend it, meekly, to Obuya at backward point who dived to his left and took an excellent, low catch
Bell is confidently, cheekily forward - half a step down the pitch - and prods at it, nudging it back to the bowler before roaring "no" with surprising volume
ah, a neat tuck through midwicket, very well timed
nicely bowled again, on off stump and it rather kept low, judging by the crab-like defence Joyce offered, spearing it wide of gully and allowing them to scamper a single
another half step down the pitch, Ongondo sends it a touch wide and Bell feels for it, tamely. And misses.
a big stride down the pitch to a wider ball, Bell punches it with the straightest of bats past mid-off
ooh, another piece of expert fishing from Joyce
pushed to leg
on leg stump once more, pushed to leg once more
outside off and he drives it down the ground
cut past point, delicately played
left alone outside his off stump
a cheeky step down the pitch which only culminates in a defensive poke
now then, I think this was a missed chance by Obuya here. Bell, back-cutting straight to him...but just short and it didn't carry
ooh and this one is edged just short of slip
calmly prodded down to third man
driven back past the bowler
a skip down the pitch and he blocks it down the ground...but in fact has timed it very well, allowing them two
Joyce comes forward, pushing it into the covers and is out of the traps immediately. Bell responds and they steal a single
outside off stump, he goes back and across to defend off the back foot
excellent ball which just moves away from Bell, slightly, who is back in defence
down the leg side. Peter Parker raises his arms to signal a wide, before letting them collapse, deciding against it
rubbish line, clipped off his legs by Bell but Ongondo does brilliantly down at fine-leg, scampering across to save four
short. Very wide. Bell tries to reach it, tries to cut it, but can only sponge it to point
very wide. Called a wide.

nearly! Bit of a ding dong from Bell, stepping across his stumps and trying to do a Pietersen, flicking him over midwicket. But he's not Pietersen, no, he's Ian Bell, and Ian Bell was very nearly bowled
grief. Well timed again. Don't think I've seen Joyce time the ball so well in an England shirt. That was just a prod, off the back foot
pushed to leg and, oh no - they're going for a run. This could be messy, and Suji picks up one-handed, underarms a throw to the stumps and Bell dives...and makes his ground. Just
defended on the front foot
too short. Pulled over midwicket for four, in front of square
oh, that's brilliant from Joyce and this is a terrific little innings so far. Too short, Joyce goes back and cuts it square for four. Easy.
punched to mid-on
watchfully defended, head right over the ball, to one on his off stump
Joyce skips down the pitch; bowler sends it down the leg side to put him off. And he's wided...that's "harsh," Nasser Hussain says, and I rather agree with him
luck of the Irish as Joyce tries to pull, gets a thick inside edge which misses his leg stump down to fine leg
pushed to mid-off and they steal a single
a skip down the pitch, trying to loft him over mid-off, but he can't quite get on top of it and smacks it straight to mid-off. Lazy, complacent stroke
my word, a beautiful drive off his first ball. He just punched it, nothing more, past mid-off
and he goes for another drive, this time to leg but picks out mid-on
timed to cover
short of a length, flicked to midwicket
turned to leg for a quick single
powerfully pumped down the ground but without timing it
short, and turned with a flick of the wrists but again without really timing
swinging into Pietersen who clumps it into the covers
a good length and that's defended into the covers

down the pitch and Nasser Hussain thinks it's a harsh wide, the batsman just following that one as it travels down leg. I hate to disagree with a former England captain, but I think Umpire Parker is right
overstepped and that's chased down again
comes forward and prods that one, standing up, into the short midwicket region
on leg and that's driven to mid-on
shuffles across and then down, driving that one to mid-on
outside off and that's driven to mid-off for a quick single
poked off the back foot into the covers
on middle and there's a loud shout for a run out, but the throw comes in too late and Pietersen was safely home, in fact he was pretty much tucked up in bed by the time that one came back
turned off the hips in front of midwicket, well timed there by Joyce
commanding punch away off the back foot and that travels
on off, good length, and Joyce defends with a straight bat, downwards
short and that's just lifted away off the hips for the maximum. Just needs an 8 next ball then we can appreciate... etc
dabbed off the hips, tamely enough, into shortmidwicket
on leg and looked to drive that one through mid-on, but got a leading edge on it
worked to point and that's well rushed out for a quick single
slants that one a tad past off and that's driven into the covers
similar slantiness, but a bit of an overstep, not good, and less good is the flash that nearly results in an edge. Not good cricket
on off and that's defended forward
defended forward
on the back foot and that's poked behind point
dropped. Good delivery, perfect first ball, pitched on off, moved away and Pietersen played that straight into Ouma's gloves
driven out over cover
looped up and that's driven through the covers
swept off the off stick and that's worked round to the 45
defended forward, tucked up quietly there
turns into the lefthander who just to say manages to bring his bat down on that one to work it short to square
creeps into that shot, shuffling across off, and drives that straight
dragged that a touch short and Pietersen pokes that out to mid-on
beautiful shot past the man at cover, to quote Mark Nicholas, he's a big strong boy, and he's just helped that one on its way
clamps down on that one, driving it cover
driven to mid-on
driven, again, to mid-on, again
can't pierce the inner ring with that drive to mid-on
Pietersen, like an excitable rabbit, scampers down to sniff the ball, decides it's a bit too dangerous and defends over it, before shuffling back to his crease
defended forward
Pietersen frisks down the track now, driving that one through mid-on - there was a throw back to the end he was running to, but again he was in safe
plants that one on a good length and Joyce does the jolly good defending bit
comes outside off and sweeps that back to the man at deep backward square leg
driven to midwicket and there's a quick single
Pietersen comes down the track - he's keen to get this finished, even now - and drives that back to mid-off
stands tall and square-drives that one to point
outside off and that's crashed through the covers on the up, waiting for it patiently before despatching it hard and fast
Pietersen gets away with that one, and then some, horrible shot, going to drive that through cover and inside edges past the keeper
leans out and I to that drive and crashes it very very hard indeed to cover
wide, and Joyce goes fishing with a big long rod outside off
defended forward this time
outside off and that nips back in at the lefthander
defended off the back foot
outside off, again, a touch short and that's worked into square
outside off again and Pietersen comes down the track, as is his wont, to meet that one and he decides in the end the best mode of defence is defence
left alone outside off
high backlift and swishes that one to cover
stays over the wicket to the lefthander, by the way, and that's swept round behind square
false shot, dangling the bat outside off, and that's beaten him
defended tidily enough this time
more defence, with a flourish turning that into something of a drive to mid-off
driven to mid-on for a quick single
on one knee and swept to square leg
helped out to just inside the boundary
worked off the front foot into midwicket
outside off and smashed, against the spin, through midwicket. "He's a freak," declares Willo
hmm, third umpire called in to adjudicate if Bhudiya, the sub, cut that one off inside the midwicket rope. And he did
well waited for a gentle dink patted through midwicket
left alone outside off
flighted wide outside off and tempts Joyce to drive that in the air just short of point
slapped down into the ground off the back foot to gully
driven to long-off
well bowled, speared in at the legs and Pietersen gets himself in a tangle
driven forward back to the bowler
driven back to mid-off
nicely played, great timing, straight, aerial and that races away
byes, as that evades the keeper
driven to covers
poked down off the back foot
driven out to long-on
saw him coming and adjusted well, defending down
defended on the back foot
driven into the covers
places that one on off, forcing Pietersen to play patiently into the covers
cuts in at Pietersen who wrists that in front of midwicket for a gentle single
defended into the covers
pushed right up there and driven comfortably to long-off for the single
short, cut to cover
and again, cut straight to cover
but he gets it this time. Too short from Tikolo and it's hammered past the infield to the extra cover boundary off the back foot. Fine shot
pushed to cover, but no run on offer there
on off stump, angling in and Joyce chips it down to long-off
flicked to leg and they scamper a quick single
ah, lovely shot, just skipping back into his crease and cracking it through cover. No great power, just lovely timing
a neat, elegant back cut
Pietersen marches down the pitch as though he has a train to catch, before paddling it to leg rather unconvincingly
pushed to leg but no run on offer there
full and flat, Pietersen pumps it to long-on for a single
terrific shot, playing it right at the last minute and late-cutting it behind square, down to the vacant third man. Beautifully, deftly played
drifting down leg, Pietersen misses out here
quicker, flatter, smacked back to the bowler
on off stump, Pietersen steps across and pings it to mid-on
on off stump, nice line but there's hardly any turn on offer for Tikolo
again on off stump, Joyce is calm in defence
clunked into the covers off the back foot
worked with a flourish of the bat to midwicket, in comes the throw as they take two - oh dear, Joyce is struggling, but it's not gathered in very well and he's safe
worked to leg
Pietersen comes forward, massively, head over the ball and works it to leg
turned to leg
pushed, with no great power, into the covers
turned around the corner and there's his 13th one-day fifty
calmly prodded back to Tikolo
ooh and he shapes to smash this over Tikolo's head but just prods it back to him, again
defended solidly on the front foot
on leg stump and whipped, easily, with a flick of the wrists to deep midwicket
gone! Terrific delivery which somehow crept through Joyce's defence...and it was the doosra! His beaming smile suggested as much, and the replays confirm it turned into the left-hander
a full toss, hammered to cover
full toss again which is timed to the bowler's right, who dives to his right and makes a good save
third full toss which is worked to leg this time, and they get a single
short and wide, Collingwood goes to cut but can't time it
Collingwood goes back, punching this off the back foot
another full toss, Collingwood splodges it through midwicket
big turn back into Collingwood who rocks back, falling to the leg side and cuts it hard into the covers
played out to the leg side for another single
lovely ball on off stump and a nice bit of drift, too
on off stump, firmly driven on the up through cover
short, wide, cut hard but straight to point
shot. Don't bother running. Too wide, much too short and Collingwood cracks it square for another four
the wrong line, down the leg side, Pietersen clips it to leg
cripes, a massive full toss. He really is struggling out there
and another full toss which England fail to dispatch. "Hammered for one" as Nasser Hussain says with Pietersen pulling it through midwicket
and he lands one! On middle-and-off, which is where he should be aiming to, and it's firmly defended
full bunger, bunged down the ground for another single
ooh, nice bit of indrift there to end the over. Pietersen gives it due respect
cracked off the back foot but straight to extra cover
far too short, Collingwood has all the time in the world to time this off the back foot, quite beautifully, for four
on off stump, defended firmly
on leg stump, Collingwood works it for a single
quicker and flatter, Pietersen watches it closely onto the bat
driven back to the bowler
too short and wide but Collingwood gets himself into a tangle, padding it away
on middle-and-off, Collingwood just works it around the corner and refuses to go for glory
turned to short fine leg, but no run on offer
drifting down leg, Collingwood wants the run but Pietersen sends him back
an expansive drive, crunched all along the turf to cover
and a quiet dab to the leg side takes England through to the Super Eights. A comprehensive seven-wicket win for them
